attack_pattern.name: PZH Pharming

obstacle.name: PZH Credentials stolen
obstacle.definition: The user types their PZH administration page credentials into an attacker's webpage

obstacle.name: PZH Admin page spoofed by attacker
obstacle.definition: The user's PZH admin page is impersonated by another webpage

obstacle.name: User clicks on link within application
obstacle.definition: A malicious application offers a link to the user's PZH admin page, which is in fact directed to a malicious webpage hosted by the attacker.

obstacle.name: User does not check PZH admin URL
obstacle.definition: The user does not check that the PZH admin page URL is what it should be

probability.rationale: People are notoriously bad at checking the URL bar

obstacle.name: PZH Admin URL not well known
obstacle.definition: The user does not know the correct URL

obstacle.name: PZH Admin URL too complicated
obstacle.definition: The PZH admin URL is complicated and easy to misread

obstacle.name: PZH Admin URL displayed without prominence
obstacle.definition: The PZH admin URL bar is not visible or easy to miss

probability.rationale: People are notoriously bad at checking the URL bar

attack_pattern.intent: Ethan wants to steal user account details for personal zones in order to create a botnet of webinos devices

structure.attack_obstacle: PZH Admin page spoofed by attacker
structure.exploit_obstacle: User does not check PZH admin URL

attack_pattern.consequences: User's online account could be disabled, the user could be locked-out temporarily, their friends or families could lose money. They could lose face and reputation as a result of the account hijack. Their devices could be misused to launch further attacks on other people and institutions.

implementation.description: Ethan creates a web application which offers a link to the user's PZH administration console. This link actually directs them to a spoofed version of their page, featuring a MITM attack on the credentials they would enter into their identity provider's webpage.
